image.altText: Composite image of four men and one woman. All are looking at the camera with neutral expressions.

props.synopsis: Four Corners talks to insiders in Israel's defence and intelligence establishment to challenge them about one of the most controversial wars in modern times.

title.children: The world wants a ceasefire. Here's why Israel's powerful voices say Netanyahu won't stop

image.altText: Image of Princess Kate and her three kids smiling into the camera.

props.synopsis: Major news and photography agencies have removed a photograph of the Princess of Wales, released by Kensington Palace, after doubts arose the image had been "manipulated".

title.children: Princess Kate photo released by royals removed by agencies over possible 'manipulation'

image.altText: A collection of menstrual products.

props.synopsis: Taxes on imported fridges, pyjamas and even dodgem cars will be scrapped in a federal government bid to clear away "nuisances" for businesses.

title.children: Tampons, toothbrushes and toasters to have 'nuisance' tariffs cut

image.altText: Firefighters in two trucks battle an out of control bushfire at Grass Patch near Esperance

props.synopsis: The acting WorkSafe commissioner has confirmed a local government CEO could be personally charged with industrial manslaughter if volunteer firefighters are killed after concerns were raised following the death of a firefighter on the state's south coast.

title.children: Councils fear laws could see CEOs charged with industrial manslaughter over volunteer firefighter deaths

image.altText: A boy smiling while sat in a ball pen

props.synopsis: The search for 12-year-old Hussein Al Mansoory has entered its third day, with police continuing their efforts to find the missing boy and imploring Auburn residents to keep an eye out.

title.children: NSW Police 'throwing everything at' search for missing 12-year-old boy

image.altText: Margot Robbie attends the 96th Annual Academy Awards on March 10, 2024 in Hollywood, California

props.synopsis: It's Oscars day! The Kens are doing their final rehearsals as some of the biggest blockbusters of 2023 prepare to battle it out at the 96th Academy Awards. Follow live.

title.children: Oppenheimer and Barbie gear up for final showdown as Oscars roll out red carpet

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Kimmel calls out Greta Gerwig's directing snub in opening monlogue
Aussie nominees to look out for

image.altText: Emma Stone, America Ferrera, and Billie Eilish on the Oscars 2024 red carpet.

props.synopsis: Any red carpet event is sure to deliver high glamour, but the Academy Awards usually attracts elegant, somewhat understated looks from the celebrities who are expecting to win. Here are some of the looks we've seen.

title.children: Oscars red carpet: Margot Robbie arrives as celebrities dress up for Hollywood's night of nights

props.synopsis: At the box office, Barbie came out on top generating $2.1 billion globally last year, but Oppenheimer has swept the major categories at this year's award shows.

title.children: Barbie beat Oppenheimer at the box office, but this awards season it has been a different story

image.altText: Young woman with long dark hair stands in front of parliament house wearing a navy jacket and arms crossed

props.synopsis: What were you doing at 19? Anjali Sharma is trying to change the law. Meet the teenager taking the fight for her generation's future from the streets to the halls of parliament.

title.children: Meet the teenager going toe-to-toe with pollies to pass a controversial law. Will she succeed?

image.altText: A man leaning on a car.

props.synopsis: Nanda, who lives about 60km from Melbourne's CBD, says he's saved up to $6,000 a year thanks to switching to an electric car. He's part of a growing trend that has seen EV sales in outer suburbs boom as cost-of-living pressures bite.

title.children: Electric car sales are booming in Australia, but it's not where you think it is

image.altText: Travis Head closes his eyes and looks disappointed at the crease

props.synopsis: New Zealand is on the verge of a rare Test win over Australia on day four in Christchurch, but Australia's middle order is still with a shout of pulling off a dramatic rescue. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Head throws his wicket away as New Zealand close in on famous Test win over Australia

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: TRAVIS HEAD IS OUT IN INCREDIBLE FASHION!
Play is due to start at 10am AEDT

image.altText: A woman pushes a shopping cart next to shelves of palm oil.

props.synopsis: Australia's neighbours have targeted palm oil, chicken wings, rice and other essentials to curb inflation. But experts say there's one thing the most successful responses have in common.

title.children: Australia's neighbours are winning their 'war' against inflation

image.altText: Fruit loops are being poured out of a see through packet into a white bowl.

props.synopsis: Deakin University researchers find seven cereal products have decreased in size but increased in cost, in an example of "shrinkflation". It comes as food policy experts warn against a suggestion that eating cereal for dinner is a solution to the cost-of-li

title.children: Food policy experts hit back at idea of cereal for dinner, as data reveals cost of shrinkflation for Australian families

image.altText: A red pedestrian bridge snakes over the swan river during sunset with city lights in the background, aerial shot.

props.synopsis: The WA premier says images will be digitally projected onto the cables supporting the structure, which is set to be completed by the end of the year and be a tourism drawcard.

title.children: Designs for Perth's new $100m pedestrian bridge spruik 'digital canvas' light displays across Swan River

image.altText: Men in suits stand around looking at their screen devices

props.synopsis: A mixed US employment report and steep fall for market darling Nvidia dragged US stocks lower on Friday, with Australian shares set to follow. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set for early falls as Wall Street retreats

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Dodgem cars, toothbrushes, chopsticks — 'nuisance' tariffs cut to reduce red tape
ASX set for red start after US stocks reversed to finish last week lower

image.altText: Firefighting at nght.

props.synopsis: Bunbury detectives and the arson squad are investigating the cause of a suspicious fire that threatened lives and homes in Dalyellup across the weekend, the third suspicious fire in the Bunbury area in under two weeks.

title.children: Arson squad investigates emergency-level blaze that forced evacuations near Bunbury

image.altText: A man waves the Palestinian flag in front of a crowd gathered on the steps of the Sydney Opera House.

props.synopsis: Some Labor insiders fear the relationship with Muslim and Arab communities is on the edge amid a growing perception the party has failed to respond to deep concerns about the war in Gaza. Elections in the US and UK suggest the ALP would be naive to ignore a potential backlash at the ballot box, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: Voters have punished Joe Biden over the war in Gaza. Is Anthony Albanese next?

image.altText: A Perth Lynx WNBL player celebrates during opening game of grand final series against Southside Flyers.

props.synopsis: Perth Lynx hit the ground running in the WNBL grand final series, defeating Southside Flyers 101-79 in the opening game in Melbourne.

title.children: Perth Lynx gain upper hand in WNBL grand final series after beating Southside Flyers

image.altText: An elderly woman in a dress stands in front of her Newcastle home.

props.synopsis: In the wake of the 2022 east coast floods, there are signs some insurers may be considering making flood cover mandatory for new customers.

title.children: Penelope opted out of flood cover when her insurance skyrocketed by $14,000, but soon it may not be an option

image.altText: A young man in wetsuit and snorkelling gear stands in the water beside a young boy in swimming shorts and snorkel

props.synopsis: More than 10,000 people could be eligible for a compensation payout from the NSW government for the criminalisation of traditional fishing practices that are protected under Commonwealth native title law.

title.children: 'Chilling effect' on culture: Class action puts spotlight on prosecution of Aboriginal fishers

image.altText: An iPhone with an Instagram post on the screen that reads "Share your secret crush story".

props.synopsis: Gabe Trew invited his social media followers to share their "secret crush story" to win a dream date just before February 14, and within 24 hours had received more than 2,000 confessions.

title.children: The average person keeps 13 secrets, five of which will never be shared

props.synopsis: The travelling circus of the AFL's Opening Round sees a Pie poke the Giants, the Blues turn their fortunes around, and a new Swan shine. These are the five quick hits.

title.children: AFL quick hits — Pies tall's bizarre moment adds some spice and Blues success rests on the boot of one man

image.altText: A drone photo above the highway with bush burnt on either side and a car and caravan travelling through.

props.synopsis: After another bushfire closes the Eyre Highway, the Shire of Dundas says it needs more support to battle the massive fires in the Great Western Woodlands.

title.children: Outback council gets just $23k a year to manage fires along one of Australia's major highways

image.altText: People at a beach in the evening.

props.synopsis: Temperatures across Victoria will reach the high 30s for the third straight day in a run of March heat not experienced since the 1940s.

title.children: Victoria swelters through its worst March heatwave in 80 years

image.altText: A woman in traditional Indian clothes looks at the camera

props.synopsis: A Point Cook woman whose body was found inside a bin beside a dirt road in regional Victoria has been remembered as a "lovely", "friendly" person who adored her young son.

title.children: Chaithanya Madhagani remembered as a 'lovely' woman adored by her son, after her body was found in bin

image.altText: an illustration of a heritage house in black and white and a tree in colour

props.synopsis: The NSW government's reforms to rezone land near dozens of train stations to allow higher housing density take effect next month.

title.children: Sweeping changes to meet housing plans could change some of Australia's oldest suburbs forever

image.altText: Danielle Scott

props.synopsis: Australian Danielle Scott defends her World Cup aerials title despite not winning any events throughout the 2023-24 season.

title.children: Bad weather sees Australian Scott retain aerials title despite not winning any events this season

image.altText: A man seen on video kicking a police car

props.synopsis: Police are trying to identify several men who attended a "large hooning event" on Saturday in Logan after three marked police cars were damaged.

title.children: Police seek several men after police cars damaged at 'large hooning event' involving YouTube star Spanian

image.altText: a small blue sailing boat oored on very still water

props.synopsis: It's been a fixture of Hobart's northern suburbs since the 1970s, but the iconic "little blue boat" could be on the move after its owner makes the tough decision to part ways with his beloved vessel.

title.children: This little blue boat has been in the same spot for nearly 50 years, but a new beginning beckons

image.altText: Two men hugging at a presentation night

props.synopsis: A statement of claim is lodged in the Victorian Supreme Court alleging multiple AFL greats were among players who racially abused the Krakouer brother in the 1980s.

title.children: North Melbourne stalwart Phil Krakouer names AFL greats in racism lawsuit

image.altText: Annemieke Mein pose with her sewing machine

props.synopsis: For many years, Annemieke Mein's art was dismissed as craft, but now the textile artist's work is the feature of a major exhibition celebrating the work she has created throughout her lifetime.

title.children: Annemieke Mein exhibition highlights artistic value of textile art

image.altText: Emergency services gather around plane.

props.synopsis: A man and woman in their 50s have avoided serious injury after the 1940s plane they were flying overturned at Shellharbour Airport in NSW.

title.children: 'A miracle outcome': Amateur photographer catches exact moment vintage plane flips during landing at NSW airport

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents
